div.l: For as hit is seyd in þe bible
Theft ⁊and ryot ben conủertible
Also he can pley on gyterne ⁊and on sautrie
And þ̉erto he bereth a lecherous eye
Reuel ⁊and trowþe as in a lowe degre
Þey ben ful wroth alday as men may se
Þis Ioly app̉rentys wᵗith his mayst̉er abod
Tyl he were nyh out of his p̉rentys hod 4400
Þauh he were snybbed boþe erly ⁊and late
And somtyme lad wᵗith Reuel to Newgate
But at þᵉ laste his maist̉er hym be þouht
Vpon an day when he his paper souht
Of a ꝓprouerbe þat seyth þis same word
Wel bet̉er is roten Appul out of hord
Þan þat he roten al þᵉ remenant
So fareth hit by a ryetous s̉eruant
Hit is wel lesse harm to late hym passe
Þan he shende alle þᵉ s̉eruantes of a place 4410
Þ̉erfore he ȝaf hym an acquitance
And bad him go wyt wyt sorewe ⁊and wᵗith meschaunce
And þus þis Ioly a pp̉rentys had his leue
Now late hym ryet al þᵉ nyth or leue
And for þ̉er is no no þef wᵗithoute a louke
Þat helpeth hym to waste ⁊and to souke
Of þat he brybe can or borewe may
Anon he send his bed ⁊and his array
Vnto a compere of his owne sort
Þat loued dys reuel ⁊and disport 4420
And had a wyf þᵗat hyred for continance
A shop ⁊and swyued for her sustinance 4422
